# p450
```{r}

# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(Hmisc)  # for Spearman correlation with p-values

# Get analyte columns and avg_p450
# Using grep to select columns that start with 'a' for analytes
analyte_columns <- grep("^a", names(data), value = TRUE)

# Ensure that 'avg_p450' is present in the dataset
if (!('avg_p450' %in% names(data))) {
  stop("Column 'avg_p450' is missing from the dataset.")
}

# Create a subset with relevant columns (avg_p450 and analytes only)
columns_of_interest <- c('avg_p450', analyte_columns)
data_subset <- data[, columns_of_interest]

# Function to calculate Spearman correlations and p-values
get_spearman_corr <- function(data, target_col) {
  corr_results <- sapply(analyte_columns, function(col) {
    result <- rcorr(data[[target_col]], data[[col]], type = "spearman")
    list(correlation = result$r[1, 2], p_value = result$P[1, 2])
  }, simplify = FALSE)
  
  corr_df <- do.call(rbind, lapply(corr_results, as.data.frame))
  rownames(corr_df) <- analyte_columns
  corr_df <- as.data.frame(corr_df)
  
  # Filter for significant correlations (p_value < 0.05) and exclude target column correlation
  significant_corrs <- subset(corr_df, p_value < 0.05 & rownames(corr_df) != target_col)
  return(significant_corrs)
}

# Calculate significant correlations for avg_p450
significant_corrs_p450 <- get_spearman_corr(data_subset, 'avg_p450')

# Add the rownames as a column for plotting
significant_corrs_p450$Analyte <- rownames(significant_corrs_p450)

# Create the plot for avg_p450 with correlation values inside the bars
ggplot(significant_corrs_p450, aes(x = correlation, y = Analyte)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "steelblue") +
  geom_text(aes(label = round(correlation, 2)), 
            hjust = ifelse(significant_corrs_p450$correlation > 0, -0.1, 1.1),
            color = "black", size = 3) + 
  labs(title = "Significant Spearman Correlations with avg_p450",
       x = "Spearman Correlation", y = "Analyte") +
  xlim(-0.35, 0.35) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

```
